item.title: Marvel Rivals: How to Listen to Stark-Fujikawa's Promo
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Listen to Stark-Fujikawa’s Promo
  • Other Achievements to Complete in the Same Map

Marvel Rivals offers a fast-paced, 6v6 team shooter gameplay experience through which the players can play as the best and the most iconic heroes and villains of the Marvel Universe. The game requires the players to play as a team and complete specific objectives to win the matches. The main gameplay elements combine action, hero-based combat, and a unique storyline.

Apart from the in-match objectives, the game also offers the players several seasonal achievements and objectives they must complete within a specific time to get certain rewards. Many achievements, like A Hounding Conversation or Whispers from the Web, consist of exciting Easter eggs from the Marvel Universe. Another achievement related to an Easter egg is the Public Relations achievement, where the players must listen to a Stark-Fujikawa promo.

How to Listen to Stark-Fujikawa’s Promo

The Public Relations achievement can only be completed by playing on the Tokyo 2099 map, as this is a location-specific objective and will require you to be in the right place at the right time to complete it.

So, to begin with the objective, enter a match on the Tokyo 2099: Shin Shibuya map, which is the same map where you can meet Spider-Zero and complete a few other achievements.

Once you have started a Convergence match in Tokyo 2099: Shin Shibuya, keep playing as usual in the first half. Once the first half ends, your team will automatically switch to the other side, and the second half will begin. The broadcast only triggers in the second half of the game, so you will have to continue and wait till the second half before listening to the broadcast.

In the second half, stay near the Stark building, and while playing, the broadcast will start automatically, and the achievement will be completed. This achievement will be completed automatically for most players, as no particular actions are needed to trigger the Stark-Fujikawa broadcast. Once the achievement is completed, you will earn five achievement points.

Other Achievements to Complete in the Same Map

Apart from the Public Relations achievement, there are also two other similar achievements that the players can complete in Tokyo 2099: Shin Shibuya.

Tough Business

In the Stark-Fujikawa building, in the second half of the game, you go near the hologram. Once you have reached the location, the uniform ad broadcast will be triggered, and the Tough Business achievement will be completed.

Eye Witness

This achievement can be completed by visiting the Public Eye building in Defender spawn in Tokyo 2099: Shin Shibuya , which will trigger Public Eye’s internal comms and complete the achievement.

item.title: 8 Best Clothing Stores In Cyberpunk 2077
item.description:
Summary

  • Trailer Park offers simple and scruffy styles, perfect for players seeking cheap and unassuming fits for a simpler lifestyle.
  • Fashion in Pacifica caters to netrunners, providing a wide variety of styles themed around hacking and the VooDoo Boys gang.
  • Stylishly stores around Night City offer a range of stylish clothing, with the Rancho Coronado location ideal for finding impressive jackets.

Cyberpunk 2077 is an RPG like no other, set in the futuristic Cyberpunk city of Night City. Appearances are incredibly important in Night City, with every gang or even regular person having their own style. When Cyberpunk 2077 was first released, clothing was essential for the player to wear due to it giving them armor.

However, since CD Projekt Red's make-over of the role-playing title, clothing has been made to be purely for aesthetics, allowing players to wear whatever they want, whenever they want. There are plenty of clothing stores to visit all across Night City, with some being arguably better than others. Those who are searching for their style should be sure to stop by these places to find it.

8 Trailer Park

A Simple And Scruffy Style

  • Found in the Trailer Park near the Badlands

Starting off with simple clothes, some players may not wish to be in the most extravagant clothing available in Cyberpunk 2077 , and therefore, they may instead find themselves looking for cheap and unassuming fits to make their V fit a simpler lifestyle.

This clothing store can't even truly be classed as a shop due to it literally being a single rack within the Trailer Park that the player can visit near River's sister's house. Some players may even feel that this clothing best fits a Nomad, especially as many of the clothes available at this stand feel incredibly worn as if the player is purchasing them second-hand.

7 Fashion (Pacifica)

Great For Netrunner Fashion

  • Found in West Wind Estate in Pacifica

One of the best play styles of Cyberpunk 2077 is being a netrunner. Being able to hack into the cybernetics of enemies to cause them to burn, malfunction, and much more is only part of the fun when players can also look the part by visiting Fashion in Pacifica.

While the netrunner costume can be found in quite a few of the Netrunner shops around the city, players are sure to find many more styles in the clothing shop of Pacifica. Since this location is also mainly home to the VooDoo Boys, it's no surprise that a lot of the clothing there is also themed around the gang and making the most of the net.

6 Stylishly

An Assortment Of Stylish Clothing

  • One of these shops can be found in Rancho Coronado in Santo Domingo.

Players who want to feel like a Night City local with the best that fashion has to provide should be sure to visit the Stylishly stores found around Night City. In these clothing shops, any V is likely to find a shirt, pants, or jacket that is sure to fit their style due to the variety of clothing being sold by these stores.

The Stylishly shop in Rancho Coronado may not be the only Stylishly store available, but players should be sure to visit this location in particular when looking for an impressive jacket that isn't the replica Johnny Silverhand one Rogue has made for the player.

5 Jinguji

Perfect For Corpos

  • Found Downtown in the City Center.

While Johnny Silverhand may shout about the evils of the corporations in Cyberpunk 2077 , a player can ignore the spouting of this old man and instead pick up some fashion tips from the corpos of Night City.

Players who are looking for high-end fashion should look no further than the City Center, which is filled with all sorts of clothing stores made for those who work a business job. Jinguji may only have a few items in store, but these clothes are sure to make the NPCs notice that V has money to waste on not only cybernetics.

4 Saeko's

Made For The Bright And Colorful

  • Found in Japantown in Westbrook.

Another great clothing store option that players will want to visit the second they are able to leave Watson is Saeko's in Japantown. The options within this store are incredibly varied but mostly loved for their kitsch style.

This is one of many fashion styles available for players to mimic in Night City that's made even more appealing as many of the clothing items found within Saeko's also allow players to attempt to mimic the style of the infamous Tyger Claws gang. Players who enjoy masks are also sure to find some great options with some sleek Oni masks.

3 Avante

Even More Corpo Style Suits

  • Found in Corpo Plaza in the City Center.

As mentioned, the Jinguji clothing shop isn't the only place where players who are looking for corpo outfits can visit. Avante within the Corpo Plaza is another great location for players who are looking to refine their fashion palette with elegant skirts and handsome suits.

While this store is another where the amount of stock at a time is quite limited, the options for clothes available are perfect, even if these suits aren't something a merc should be wearing to complete their various gigs around Night City. These outfits also don't just come in black to allow V to have a pop of color.

2 Fashion (Dogtown)

The DLC Added Exclusive Clothes

  • Found in Dogtown with the Phantom Liberty DLC.

Dogtown is a location that was added with the one and only DLC for Cyberpunk 2077. Although this means the clothes within this store aren't available to all players, it still feels important to mention the Fashion store within Dogtown is a must-visit for anyone who has purchased Phantom Liberty.

The DLC not only added a phenomenal story but also plenty of new clothes for players to decorate themselves with. These clothes can also only be found within Dogtown, making them something a player must visit at least once to refresh their style.

1 Ded Zed

Some Of The Best Clothes Bought Early

  • Found in Northside in Watson.

Out of all the available clothing stores in Cyberpunk 2077, one of the greatest for those looking to expand the fashion of V should look no further than Ded Zed. Not only does this clothing store have plenty for the player to choose from, with new stock sure to be added as the player levels to also allow them to improve their fashion, but this shop is also one of the earliest a player can visit.

Since Ded Zed is found within Watson, players don't need to worry about stealing the Relic to let them explore the rest of Night City. This allows players to find some decent threads early into their adventure in the RPG.

item.title: Amazing PC Games With Low System Requirements
item.description:
PC offers by far the most varied gaming library in the industry. While associated with raw graphical power due to the ever-growing capabilities of GPUs and CPUs, major AAA projects that need fairly modern hardware are merely a drop in the bucket. Each week, Steam and the Epic Games Store welcome dozens of great low-end PC games , ensuring players with older systems or non-gaming laptops always have something to look forward to.

Furthermore, patient players can turn to decades of AAA games that are accessible nowadays, with most running at near-perfect quality on modern low-spec PCs. As there are thousands of options available, picking out a few of the best PC games for low-end PCs can be quite challenging. As such, let's highlight a few of them.

Updated February 14, 2025 by Mark Sammut : Galleries have been added for every low-spec PC game mentioned in this article. Also, a January 2025 release has been introduced as a recommendation.

What Constitutes A Low-Spec Game?

The definition of "low-spec" varies from person to person. For some folks, a desktop with a GTX 1050ti and a 9th gen CPU would qualify; meanwhile, for others, low-spec means a non-gaming laptop that does not have a dedicated graphics card. Consequently, each game's minimum requirements will be included to provide some guidance, and the definition of "low-spec" will be treated as flexible.

Systemrequirementslab is a useful resource to check whether a computer can run a game.

Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector

Both Citizen Sleeper games are fantastic tabletop-style RPGs that prioritize dialogue, NPC interactions, and consequential choices. While the second entry is being highlighted due to recency bias, the first title is still very good and leads directly into its successor, so newcomers might want to start from the beginning rather than jump directly into Citizen Sleeper 2 .

As the eponymous Sleeper, players take charge of an android with human memories, and they are trying to escape from an organization that owns them. In the second entry, the protagonist explores a belt with different planets, and they take charge of a crew, which adds a fun dynamic to the original gameplay loop. Time-management is a big part of the experience, as are dice-dictated outcomes that impact the player's journey.

Balatro

Steam User Rating: 98%

Earning a nomination for best game of 2024 by the Game Awards, Balatro is an incredible achievement, especially considering it was made by a one-person development team. Inspired by Poker but not featuring any real gambling, Balatro is a clever roguelike and deck-builder that has a simple but addictive loop that is perfect for both quick explosive sessions and hours-long marathons. While there are plenty of nuances to consider, the main goal is to achieve the required score as quickly as possible, all in the hopes of moving on to the next round.

Balatro is a fantastic game that can keep somebody entertained for an extremely long time, and it requires barely any juice under the hood to operate. Speaking purely in terms of quality to system requirements, Balatro might be the most valuable on Steam in this day and age, especially since it is a 2024 release and not a classic that has been around for years.

An early access indie project, TCG Card Shop Simulator has relentless charm, and it could fulfill a childhood dream for some players. The stock must be constantly replenished and expanded, while customers need to be monitored to see how they react to the set prices. Also, some clients might smell just a little bit, and that can be bad for business.

TCG Card Shop Simulator is not going to be for everyone, but anyone craving a relaxing management sim with a simple structure that provides some wiggle room or experimentation. There is even the option to open packs to find cards that can be showcased in cabinets, which should scratch someone's collecting itch.

A short and creepy 2.5D adventure, Little Nightmares brings to life a terrifying world called the Maw, which features twisted takes on fairly commonplace roles like cooks. As Six, players are relatively defenseless, forcing them to sneak through stages while solving puzzles and trying desperately to avoid detection. While the gameplay is nothing too extraordinary, Little Nightmares gets by on sheer atmosphere and effective character designs, both for Six and the Maw's various residents.

Even in 2017, Tarsier Studios' game was hardly a graphical powerhouse, but that does not mean Little Nightmares looks cheap or bad. In fact, the graphics have aged pretty darn well as they are stylish rather than realistic. As such, this horror title will always be worth playing. The sequel is also great and does not require a powerful rig, but it is naturally more demanding than its predecessor.

Animal Well

Steam User Rating: 96%

In 2024's early months, the PC scene welcomed Palworld , Enshrouded , Dragon's Dogma 2 , Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth , Tekken 8 , Horizon Forbidden West , Unicorn Overlord , and Persona 3 Reload , all of which garnered near-universal praise. However, one of the year's best releases to date was an indie Metroidvania with such low system requirements that they almost seem wrong. Running on most computers with specs (and Windows 10), Animal Well is a stunning and fresh entry in a genre that has been somewhat overexposed in recent years. With almost no setup, the game drops players in a surreal and atmospheric setting and just lets them be, encouraging them to go out, explore, collect eggs, and face off against a couple of bosses.

Unlike many Metroidvanias, Animal Well focuses on puzzles rather than combat; in fact, the latter is almost entirely absent, although players can use fireworks to take down or stall enemies. Each part of the map effectively functions as a mini-braintmeteaser, encouraging lateral thinking and clever use of the available tools to unlock gates and get past obstacles. Even boss fights are puzzles. Naturally, exploration is also a big part of the package, and the same can be said for platforming. The latter is simple but enjoyable, while the former is generally rewarding despite some frustrating moments.

Borderlands 2

Borderlands 2 is in a strange place for a recommendation. On the one hand, it is (overall) the best and most complete entry in Gearbox's franchise. The story has aged incredibly well and is considerably better than Borderlands or Borderlands 3 , largely thanks to the presence of Handsome Jack. Although not quite on the same level as its successors, the 2012 FPS's visuals are still fine and pleasing, which mostly speaks to the timeless nature of cel-shaded graphics. The randomized loot and varied classes provide quite a lot of replay-value, while the co-op is implemented well.

For all its strengths, Borderlands 2 's gunplay shows its age, and it was never great to begin with. The gameplay lacks punch and is quite floaty, making for an uneven experience when compared to modern releases. Still, the good outweighs the bad, warranting a try as long as expectations are kept realistic.

Dave The Diver

Steam User Rating: 97%

One of 2023's nicest surprises, Dave the Diver is a pixelated delight. Restaurant and fishing sims are not particularly uncommon, but very few games not only combine the two but also create something that feels genuinely unique. Despite sharing many similarities with other projects, Dave the Diver is one of a kind. As Dave, players find themselves owning a new sushi restaurant, and they are also in charge of acquiring the fish that will be served to customers. During the day, Dave dives into a peculiar sea in search of ingredients that his restaurant can then serve at night.

Although not the deepest restaurant manager on the market, Dave the Diver grants players a fair amount of control over the restaurant's direction, allowing them enough creative input to give the experience a personal touch. While these sections are fun, the game is at its best when focusing on diving. Blending exploration, combat, and some customization, the dives are surprisingly action-packed, and they have quite a bit of variety as well.

Hotline Miami

Steam User Rating: 97%

Hotline Miami follows a nameless protagonist who receives cryptic messages that are generally interpreted as "go here and kill everyone." Set in the late '80s, the top-down shooter is drenched in neon lights and video game eccentricities that inspire players to not give much consideration to the reasons behind their actions. As the killer shoots their way through a building's floors, they leave behind a trail of blood, guts, and bonus points.

Straightforward as the formula sounds on paper, Hotline Miami contains quite a bit of depth, both in the way stages need to be approached and the narrative that drives the slaughter. Perhaps more importantly, the game is a lot of fun to play, and it has not aged a bit since its 2012 debut. Hotline Miami is not just one of the best low-end PC games but also one of the greatest projects of all time.

Eric wakes up on a treacherous island without his son, and he soon comes to realize that surviving a plane crash was the easy part of this adventure. A survival horror game, The Forest incorporates most of the standard elements associated with the genre, including crafting tools, building shelter, and finding food. Eric must also deal with the locals who happen to be cannibals, although they are not necessarily evil (or good).

The Forest is a must-play for survival or horror fans. While not especially striking in the visual department, its gameplay and story are rock-solid. A sequel called Sons of the Forest launched in February 2023, but that requires more juice under a computer's hood.

Valve does a fantastic job optimizing its games, with pretty much all of them playing well on low-end PCs. Portal 2 is no exception, although the game can look pretty fantastic with high-end graphics. But even "watered down," and with the settings on low, Portal 2 is one of the most engaging and entertaining puzzle adventures ever produced. Most players come to experience the hilarious storyline and stellar voice action, only to be completely gripped by Portal's unique brand of gameplay.

What's even better is that Portal 2 can be enjoyed with a friend, thanks to an entirely separate cooperative storyline. This means there's twice as much to see and do in Portal 2 , and it should all run smoothly with low requirements.

Released in 2019 before receiving an updated version two years later, Disco Elysium is among the most decorated RPGs of the last decade. ZA/UM's game follows an amnesiac detective who is assigned a murder case, one that quickly spirals out of control while also revealing different facades of the protagonist.

Presented from an isometric angle, Disco Elysium is reminiscent of old-school '90s RPGs that prioritize world-building and dialogue over action. Set in cyberpunk-esque universe, the story dives into the political ideologies that shape the world's various cultures, and the player's choices impact the protagonist's thought patterns and beliefs. Disco Elysium is a story-driven experience with fantastic writing, unforgettable characters, and genuinely impactful choices. Anyone looking for an action-packed game with good visuals, fun gameplay, and a passable storyline will find what they are looking for in this title.

Tomb Raider is well-optimized on PC, and the game is likely to run on most (relatively) modern systems. On low settings, the game can be played on a laptop with Intel HD Graphics 3000 and a halfway decent processor. Lara might lag on occasion, but she will run.

Crash-landing on planet 4546B, Ryley Robinson finds herself alone in a world consisting primarily of water. In order to survive and perhaps find a way off this rock, the protagonist must scour the ocean for resources, a process that is just as likely to produce beautiful or nightmarish sights.

Those who enjoy punishing gameplay and strategy elements should put Darkest Dungeon at the top of their list. This gritty, macabre RPG is downright unfair at times, hitting players with strings of bad luck and RNG-generated madness. Even the smartest and most prepared players can find themselves hopelessly clinging to life at the hands of Darkest Dungeon 's mechanics.

Thanks to its charming 2D aesthetic and side-scrolling action, Darkest Dungeon doesn't require an immense amount of PC power to run smoothly. A lack of complex particle effects paired with its hand-drawn and sometimes simplistic graphics allows players with low-end PCs to join in on the fun. It also features a pretty dedicated modding community, so there's a lot of customization to be found.

Undertale firmly plants itself as an Indie release that proves that a game can have a fantastic story, fun gameplay, and engaging characters with minimal graphics and effects.

Toby Fox created an incredibly imaginative world that spawned a massive cult following thanks to its colorful cast of characters, incredible soundtrack, and fast-paced dodge-based gameplay elements. Anyone who hasn't played Undertale is seriously missing out and its ability to run well on even the lowest of low-end PCs gives almost anyone a chance to experience it.

And, of course, it's hard to mention the genre without bringing up the best title: Stardew Valley . This game wears a lot of different hats over the core farming gameplay loop, and it executes everything it tries to do well.

In terms of running games on low-end computers , the minimum requirements for Stardew Valley include Windows Vista as the operating system, among other quaint settings. If that doesn't indicate the fact this game can run on anything, I don't know what else will. It's frequently on sale, so PC game players both hardcore and casual have no excuse to not pick up Stardew Valley .

Kerbal Space Program strives for realism, and players need to know what they are doing if they want a successful lift-off, let alone complete a full trip.

Even though the gameplay is difficult to master, the journey tends to be fun regardless of whether a mission ends in triumph or failure. Kerbal Space Program has an active online community that has crafted tons of great mods and is likely to keep the game active for a long time.

The game is simple and easy to learn but with so much depth in building decks that each character can play radically differently between each attempt. For example, the mage analog in The Defect can use its elemental orbs to succeed or can pick up a bunch of Claws and rip enemies apart. It's so much fun to experiment, and getting an overpowered run is an amazing dopamine hit.

For low-end PCs , the game's style is what carries it over the edge. It doesn't look like a typical card game, but it certainly runs like one. Even the slowest of PCs can get the game going without too much effort. For fans of the genres Slay the Spire flirts with, it's definitely worth it to check out.

The gameplay is intuitive and addictive for both the battle royale mode and Save the World , while Fortnite 's love for cross-promotion has prolonged its existence in the public eye.

Set around a camp that trains the eponymous psychonauts, the story follows Raz, a charming boy who has access to quite a few unique abilities. item.title: Final Fantasy: 8 Characters Who Ended Up Being Surprisingly Strong
item.description:
Summary

  • Some Final Fantasy characters initially seem weak but can become incredibly powerful at very high levels.
  • Characters like Edward and Relm surprise players by showcasing their true strength despite first impressions.
  • Underestimated characters like Yuffie, Krile, and Rydia prove their worth via powerful abilities and transformations.

Final Fantasy is one of the greatest JRPG franchises of all time. Fans of the series tend to love how much fun it is to level up their parties, explore dungeons, and take on powerful bosses who will eventually be brought to their knees by the player's strength.

Some party members are very strong and capable of holding their own in battle, but there are others who seem rather weak and aren't worth the effort of leveling up. At least, that's what it initially seems like. Some Final Fantasy playable characters have become legendary for how powerful they are, despite their outward appearance or poor first impression.

8 Edward Chris Von Muir

At Very High Levels, His Stats Reach Astronomical Heights

While Edward is an interesting person, his effectiveness as a party member is rather muted during his cameo appearance as a playable character. As a Bard, he's only suitable as a support character and can easily fall in battle if he's not placed in the back row and protected.

However, after level 70, Edward's stats skyrocket to the point where he can enjoy the highest stats out of any other party member. This fact will make many fans scratch their heads, especially since he will exit the party long before reaching this level unless players grind for an unreal number of hours.

7 Relm Arrowny

Despite Looking Rather Weak, Her Magical Abilities Are Incredible

Relm is one of the peppiest characters in Final Fantasy 6 , making a major impression from the very moment she appears on-screen. She's the only character Interceptor is friendly with, and she has an interesting Sketch ability, even if it feels rather weak to execute in battle.

However, players who write off this young character will be missing out on one of the most potent magic users in the game, one who can annihilate entire enemy mobs with a single Black Magic spell. The fact that she can dwarf her grandfather in power despite the latter being presented as the better magic user of the duo is a testament to how unassumingly strong Relm is.

6 Krile Mayer Baldesion

Replaces Her Grandfather And Inherits All Of His Strength

Galuf's death is one of the most harrowing moments in Final Fantasy 5 , with the former Warrior of Light sacrificing himself to save his friends and granddaughter. Krile arrives to replace him, with many assuming that they would have to build up this character from level 1 after the experience they had with Cecil at Mt. Ordeals in Final Fantasy 4 .

This is why fans were left pleasantly surprised when they opened the menu screen, only to see that Krile had inherited all the levels and job masteries of her grandfather. It may be hard to justify her strength, but most didn't mind as long as they got to enjoy a powerful story moment that ended with a convenient character switch instead of an unreal grind.

5 Yuffie Kisaragi

Her Limit Breaks Are Ridiculously Powerful

Yuffie is one of the most annoying party members to recruit in Final Fantasy 7 . She runs away from the player whenever they make a single mistake, and she even steals their materia when they land in Wutai.

To make things worse, Yuffie isn't even all that strong early on when compared to the rest of the party members in Final Fantasy 7 . However, players who acquire the Doom of the Living and All Creation Limit Breaks can obliterate enemies with her in battle, with the former being especially potent against single enemies as long as Yuffie's base damage stats are at an impressive level.

4 Selphie Tilmitt

Her Slots Limit Break Can End Battles In No Time

Given how the Junction System can render most natural stat growths moot in Final Fantasy 8 , strength in this game is usually determined by the Limit Breaks players can spam once they gain access to Aura. This is why Selphie can seem so weak, with her bubbly personality and Slots Limit Break making her seem rather underwhelming in combat.

However, players who manage to game these slots can re-roll over and over again to gain access to some of the most potent spells in the game. Full-cure and Wall are amazing support spells that dwarf everything else, while Rapture can instantly take out foes susceptible to Instant Death. However, her most powerful technique by far is The End, which is so powerful that even Ultimecia and Omega Weapon aren't immune to its devastating fight-ending effects.

3 Rikku

Mixing Is Integral To Deal With The Game's Hardest Challenges

Given how simple and damaging the bulk of Overdrives are in Final Fantasy 10 , Rikku's Mix seems like a lot of work. Her role as a Thief makes her less potent as a damage dealer, too, making it easy to see why most people write her off as one of the weakest Final Fantasy characters.

However, veterans of Final Fantasy 10 and its many challenge runs will be well aware of how important Rikku's Mix is when she is going up against a tough enemy. The fact that Megalixirs are not even the most potent thing Rikku can make is a testament to her strength, with other concoctions like Hyper Mighty G and Trio of 9999 turning most boss encounters into a joke.

2 Rydia

A Kid With No Control Over Her Powers Transforms Into A Powerful Summoner

When players control Rydia for the first time, she's little more than a weak child who must be brought up from level 1 in order to tackle the many threats that come their way. She leaves the party not long after, causing many players to breathe a sigh of relief that they don't have to constantly heal and revive the weakest party member they've possibly controlled in a Final Fantasy game.

However, Rydia does a 180 after aging up and rejoining the party. She becomes a competent Summoner who can invoke the power of astral beings to decimate her foes in style, making her one of the most fun characters to control. She is also a must-have against bosses who are weak to elemental attacks.

1 Umaro

A Berserker That Players Can't Control, But He Makes Up For It With Incredible Strength

  • Final Fantasy 6

Most people write off Umaro as an annoying party member, given his role as a Berserker. Typically, players want to enjoy direct control over their party, and Umaro may throw a wrench in certain strategies if everything doesn't go according to plan.

However, players who give this yeti a chance will be impressed by how ridiculously strong he can be. His efficiency can be improved with the Berserker Ring and the Blizzard Orb, two relics that enhance his repertoire of moves and make him a fun wild card to use in battle, pounding enemies to oblivion with his impressive physical moves.
